Sequence Information.Peptide Name: aCATH (Gly-rich; Ser-rich; natural AMPs; ayu cathelicidin; fish, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: highly expressed in spleen, liver, and head kidney, ayu,Plecoglossus altivelis

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram-negative L. anguillarum (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), A. salmonicida (MIC 50 ug/ml), V. alginolyticus (MIC 5.2 ug/ml), A. hydrophila (MIC 1.5 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), E. ictaluri (MIC 25 ug/ml), E. coli BL21 (MIC 100 ug/ml), V. parahaemolyticus (MIC 25 ug/ml), V. harveyi (MIC 6.2 ug/ml), V. vulnificus (MIC 100 ug/ml), and V. fluvialis (MIC 3.1 ug/ml).Host expression:induced:   Expression can be induced by bacterial infection.Updated 8/2016; 6/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Lu XJ, Chen J, Huang ZA, Shi YH, Lv JN.2011
Literature Information.Title: Identification and characterization of a novel cathelicidin from ayu, Plecoglossus altivelis
